001// Copyright (c) Choreo contributors
002
003package choreo.auto;
004
005import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
006import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger;
013import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
014
015/**
016 * An object that represents an autonomous routine.
017 *
018 * <p>This loop is used to handle autonomous trigger logic and schedule commands. This loop should
019 * **not** be shared across multiple autonomous routines.
020 *
021 * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a routine from a AutoFactory
022 */
023public class AutoRoutine {
024  /**
025   * The factory that created this loop. This is used to create commands that are associated with
026   * this loop.
027   */
028  protected final AutoFactory factory;
029
030  /** The underlying {@link EventLoop} that triggers are bound to and polled */
031  protected final EventLoop loop;
032
033  /** The name of the auto routine this loop is associated with */
034  protected final String name;
035
036  /** A boolean utilized in {@link #running()} to resolve trueness */
037  protected boolean isActive = false;
038
039  /** A boolean that is true when the loop is killed */
040  protected boolean isKilled = false;
041
042  /** The amount of times the routine has been polled */
043  protected int pollCount = 0;
044
045  /** Returns true if the alliance is known or is irrelevant (i.e. flipping is not being done) */
046  protected BooleanSupplier allianceKnownOrIgnored = () -> true;
047
048  /**
049   * A constructor to be used when inhereting this class to instantiate a custom inner loop
050   *
051   * @param factory The factory that created this loop
052   * @param name The name of the loop
053   * @param loop The inner {@link EventLoop}
054   */
055  protected AutoRoutine(AutoFactory factory, String name, EventLoop loop) {
056    this.factory = factory;
057    this.loop = loop;
058    this.name = name;
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Creates a new loop with a specific name
063   *
064   * @param factory The factory that created this loop
065   * @param name The name of the loop
066   * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a loop from a AutoFactory
067   */
068  protected AutoRoutine(AutoFactory factory, String name) {
069    this(factory, name, new EventLoop());
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Creates a new loop with a specific name and a custom alliance supplier.
074   *
075   * @param factory The factory that created this loop
076   * @param name The name of the loop
077   * @param allianceKnownOrIgnored Returns true if the alliance is known or is irrelevant (i.e.
078   *     flipping is not being done).
079   * @see AutoFactory#newRoutine Creating a loop from a AutoFactory
080   */
081  protected AutoRoutine(AutoFactory factory, String name, BooleanSupplier allianceKnownOrIgnored) {
082    this(factory, name);
083    this.allianceKnownOrIgnored = allianceKnownOrIgnored;
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Returns a {@link Trigger} that is true while this autonomous routine is being polled.
088   *
089   * <p>Using a {@link Trigger#onFalse(Command)} will do nothing as when this is false the routine
090   * is not being polled anymore.
091   *
092   * @return A {@link Trigger} that is true while this autonomous routine is being polled.
093   */
094  public Trigger running() {
095    return new Trigger(loop, () -> isActive && DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled());
096  }
097
098  /** Polls the routine. Should be called in the autonomous periodic method. */
099  public void poll() {
100    if (!DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled()
101        || !allianceKnownOrIgnored.getAsBoolean()
102        || isKilled) {
103      isActive = false;
104      return;
105    }
106    pollCount++;
107    loop.poll();
108    isActive = true;
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Gets the event loop that this routine is using.
113   *
114   * @return The event loop that this routine is using.
115   */
116  public EventLoop loop() {
117    return loop;
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Creates a {@link Trigger} that is bound to the routine's {@link EventLoop}.
122   *
123   * @param condition The condition represented by the trigger.
124   * @return A {@link Trigger} that mirrors the state of the provided {@code condition}
125   */
126  public Trigger observe(BooleanSupplier condition) {
127    return new Trigger(loop, condition);
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Gets the poll count of the routine.
132   *
133   * @return The poll count of the routine.
134   */
135  int pollCount() {
136    return pollCount;
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Resets the routine. This can either be called on auto init or auto end to reset the routine
141   * incase you run it again. If this is called on a routine that doesn't need to be reset it will
142   * do nothing.
143   */
144  public void reset() {
145    pollCount = 0;
146    isActive = false;
147  }
148
149  /** Kills the loop and prevents it from running again. */
150  public void kill() {
151    CommandScheduler.getInstance().cancelAll();
152    if (isKilled) {
153      return;
154    }
155    reset();
156    DriverStation.reportWarning("Killed An Auto Loop", true);
157    isKilled = true;
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
162   *
163   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
164   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
165   */
166  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName) {
167    return factory.trajectory(trajectoryName, this);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
172   *
173   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
174   * @param splitIndex The index of the split trajectory to use.
175   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
176   */
177  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex) {
178    return factory.trajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex, this);
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an auto routine.
183   *
184   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
185   * @param trajectory The trajectory to use.
186   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
187   */
188  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoTrajectory trajectory(
189      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory) {
190    return factory.trajectory(trajectory, this);
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
195   *
196   * <p>The command will end instantly and kill the routine if the alliance supplier returns an
197   * empty optional when the command is scheduled.
198   *
199   * @return A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is cancelled.
200   * @see #cmd(BooleanSupplier) A version of this method that takes a condition to finish the loop.
201   */
202  public Command cmd() {
203    return cmd(() -> false);
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Creates a command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
208   *
209   * <p>The command will end instantly and kill the routine if the alliance supplier returns an
210   * empty optional when the command is scheduled.
211   *
212   * @param finishCondition A condition that will finish the loop when it is true.
213   * @return A command that will poll this event loop and reset it when it is finished or canceled.
214   * @see #cmd() A version of this method that doesn't take a condition and never finishes except if
215   *     the alliance supplier returns an empty optional when scheduled.
216   */
217  public Command cmd(BooleanSupplier finishCondition) {
218    return Commands.either(
219        Commands.run(this::poll)
220            .finallyDo(this::reset)
221            .until(() -> !DriverStation.isAutonomousEnabled() || finishCondition.getAsBoolean())
222            .withName(name),
223        Commands.runOnce(
224            () -> {
225              DriverStation.reportWarning(
226                  "[Choreo] Alliance not known when starting routine", false);
227              kill();
228            }),
229        allianceKnownOrIgnored);
230  }
231}
